**II.

Vaccine Inspection and Preparation**

* Visually inspect the vaccine vial for signs of damage, for expirations dates, other abnormalities prior to administration.

Prepare the Vaccine**

* Check the expiration date and integrity of the vaccine vial.
* Choose the appropriate needle size based on the patient's age and weight.
* Remove the vaccine from the refrigerator and allow it to come to room temperature (if necessary).
* Remove the cap from the vial and swirl the contents gently to ensure the powder (if applicable) is fully dissolved.
* Withdraw the correct dose into the syringe according to the manufacturer's instructions.

**III.

Identify the Injection Site**

* The deltoid muscle in the upper arm is the recommended injection site for adults and children over 3 years old.

Administer the Vaccine**

* Identify the appropriate administration site, as determined by the patient's age and health status:
	+ Deltoid muscle of the upper arm for adults and children >  = 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for infants and children < 3 years old.
+ Thigh muscle for children < 3 years old.
+ Anterior-lateral thigh (4 cm above the knee) for infants < 3 years old.
+ Anterior thigh for infants <3 years old (may require dividing the dose between both legs).
+ Anterioral (front side) aspect of the mid-thigh for infants and young children < 3 years old.
+ Anterior-lateral aspect of the mid-thigh for children 6-36 months old.
+ Mid-lateral thigh for infants < 1 year old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for children ≥ 6 months to < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh region for infants and toddlers (>6 months to <3 years old).
+ Vastus lateralis muscle of the thigh for children < 3 years old.
+ Quadriceps muscle in the mid-thigh for children aged < 3 years.
+ Anterolateral aspect of the thigh for children 18-35 months old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for infants and children < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for infants and children < 3 years old.
+ Vastus lateralis muscle of the thigh for children < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for infants 12-35 months old.
+ Anterolateral aspect of the mid-thigh for children < 3 years old.
+ Vastus lateralis muscle of the thigh for infants < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for infants < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral aspect of the thigh for infants < 3 years old.
+ Mid-thigh anteriorly (front of the leg) for infants < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral aspect of the mid-thigh for children < 3 years old.
+ Middle third of the thigh (Vastus lateralis) for children between 1-2 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh muscle for children < 3 years old.
+ Vastus lateralis muscle of the thigh for infants and young children < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for infants < 3 years old.
+ Outer aspect of the mid-thigh (anterolateral surface) for children <3 years old.
+ Mid-lateral region of the leg for younger children and infants (< 3 years old).
+ Anterolateral thigh for infants < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh muscle for children < 3 years old (using a shorter needle).
+ Anterolateral thigh for children < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral aspect of the thigh for infants and children < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for children < 3 years old.

+ Vastus lateralis (outer mid-thigh) for infants and toddlers < 3 years old.
+ Anterolateral thigh for infants < 3 years old.
